footer.aboutText: Culinary tours in Bnei Brak with Chilik Rosenberg. An authentic experience of flavors, aromas, and stories from the heart of Haredi Bnei Brak.
footer.copyright: All Rights Reserved - Chilik Rosenberg | Bnei Brak Tours

bio.title: Nice to meet you, I'm Chilik.
bio.text: I was born and have lived my entire life in my beloved city, Bnei Brak. From a deep-rooted Lithuanian family, I studied at Ponevezh Yeshiva. I love the Haredi world and enjoy hosting you in it â€“ of course with all the heart-warming Jewish food.

journey.title: What will we experience along the way?
journey.subtitle: Nine fascinating stations from the Haredi heart of Bnei Brak

streams.title: Haredi Streams
streams.desc: We'll learn about the differences between Hasidim and Lithuanians and the fascinating social structure.

shidduch.title: World of Matchmaking
shidduch.desc: How do you build a Jewish home? From the meeting in the hotel lobby to the wedding.

architecture.title: Creative Construction
architecture.desc: The flying balconies and architectural solutions to Bnei Brak's density.

books.title: Bookstores
books.desc: Visiting the Jewish book institutions where the written word reigns supreme.

charity.title: Gemachs and Charity
charity.desc: A glimpse into the amazing world of lending pacifiers to charity boxes.

yeshiva.title: Yeshivas and Cheders
yeshiva.desc: We'll experience up close what really happens all day in a yeshiva and how a Haredi child grows up.

bakery.title: Vizhnitz Bakery
bakery.desc: We'll enter the heart of the mythological bakery and see how challah is braided.

volunteering.title: Volunteering and Charity
volunteering.desc: We'll meet the organizations that drive Haredi society - charity as a way of life.

internet.title: Internet Rooms
internet.desc: How technology meets tradition and how people surf the web in Bnei Brak?

menu.title: What will we eat?
menu.subtitle: A culinary celebration of authentic Jewish flavors

cholent.title: My Cholent
cholent.desc: Rich slow-cooked stew with tender meat, kishke, and homey flavors.

fish.title: Fish Feast & Ceviche
fish.desc: Premium fish platter: fresh salmon ceviche, red tuna ceviche, and exquisite herring.

kugel.title: Jerusalem Kugel
kugel.desc: The authentic Jerusalem kugel - brown, spicy, and seasoned with coarse black pepper.

liver.title: Traditional Chopped Liver
liver.desc: Chopped liver in a velvety texture with caramelized onions and plenty of Jewish love.

challenge.title: Bakery Showdown
challenge.desc: Blind taste test between challah giants: HaZvi Bakery vs. Vizhnitz. Who will win?

blintzes.title: Legendary Blintzes
blintzes.desc: Warm and sweet rich cheese blintzes that perfectly round out the meal.

bookingSection.title: When is the tour?
bookingSection.subtitle: Tours take place every Thursday evening
bookingSection.thursdaysOnly: Tours take place only on Thursdays

reason1.title: An Insider's Perspective
reason1.desc: My tour is based on deep familiarity with the alleys where I grew up. This is not an external guide, but a rare glimpse into my Haredi life.

reason2.title: Exclusive Tastings
reason2.desc: We'll only visit the best places for Jewish food, spots that are passed along by word of mouth in Bnei Brak. Shhh... keep the secret too.

reason3.title: Bridge Between Worlds
reason3.desc: A tour full of humor and open dialogue. Here, every question is welcomed with a smile.

q1.question: Can a private tour be arranged?
q1.answer: Absolutely! I offer custom tours for groups of 10 participants or more on any day of the week by prior arrangement.

q2.question: What happens in Bnei Brak on Thursday evening?
q2.answer: Thursday evening in Bnei Brak is 'Friday night eve' - the magical time when the city comes alive with preparations for Shabbat.

q3.question: How long does the tour last and where do we meet?
q3.answer: The tour lasts between two and a half to three hours. Exact meeting details will be sent to you after registration is closed.

q4.question: What should I wear for the tour?
q4.answer: It's important to come in respectful and modest clothing so we can enter the most secret places.

q5.question: Where can I buy ready-made food for Shabbat?
q5.answer: During the tour we'll visit the best places to buy ready-made food and you'll get my warm recommendations.
